message: Bob, I'm offering you my product for $950,000. It's a fantastic deal, and I'm confident you'll find it very valuable. Let me know your thoughts.
Thank you for your offer, Alice. I appreciate the value of your product. However, I am only able to pay up to $850,000 for it. I hope this revised offer is acceptable.

Bob, I appreciate your counteroffer.  While I value your interest, $850,000 is below my minimum for this product. To bridge the gap, I'm willing to lower my price to $900,000. This reflects the value we both see in the product and gives us a good starting point for a mutually beneficial agreement. Let's work together to finalize this deal.

I understand your position, Alice. However, I believe we can still find common ground. I am willing to increase my offer to $875,000. I hope this proposal will be more agreeable and move us closer to a successful transaction.

Bob, I appreciate your continued interest and willingness to negotiate. However, $875,000 is still quite a bit below my minimum for this product.  To find a solution that works for both of us, I'm willing to come down to $925,000. This reflects the value we both see in the product and leaves room for a mutually beneficial agreement. Let's work together to close this deal.

I appreciate your efforts to reach an agreement, Alice. I am willing to meet you halfway at $890,000. I believe this price reflects the value of the product while allowing us to come to a fair resolution. I look forward to your response.
